text: The Imam Muhammad ibn Saud Islamic University () in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, was founded in 1953. In 1974, it was granted university status by royal decree. It has a library, the Prince Sultan Library For Science and Knowledge, that has existed before the university. The university started running the library in 1975. The library is a partner of the World Digital Library. ==References== ==Other websites== *Official website Category:Riyadh Category:Colleges and universities in Saudi Arabia Category:1953 establishments in Asia Category:1950s establishments in Saudi Arabia
title: Imam Muhammad ibn Saud Islamic University
